results.title: Individual differences & developmental milestones
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Traces the course of sensorimotor development over the first year. Examines the results of comtemporary research on temperament, auditory and visual acuity, depth perception, phonemic discrimination and cross-modality matching. Presents newborns as they confront situations that allow them to exhibit their capacity to act, learn and remember.

results.title: Individual differences
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Educational Psychology”.
The case study of a shy, slow child, who is different from his classmates and from his older, socially-adept brother, whose reputation is a constant reminder of his own shortcomings. Everyone needs to succeed, the film points out, and most of all those in terms of individual interests and capabilities. It is the job of the school to shape education to these individual needs.

results.title: Indigenous Australians : an Aboriginal community focus
results.brief_description: An interactive CDROM from NSW TAFE which is the first to draw on the comprehensive knowledge and expertise of Aboriginal community members and is an invaluable teaching resource. The concept behind the CD ROM is to let members of various Aboriginal communities become teachers of their rich culture. A resource guide accompanies the CD ROM.

results.title: Indian village
results.brief_description: Sucksdorff, the distinguished Swedish director visited India in 1951 and made two films “Wind and the river” and “Indian village”. “Indian village” was intended to be shown throughout India to persuade peasants to discard their centuries-old methods of cultivation and village administration and to adopt modern methods of co-operation. The story Sucksdorff has chosen is centred on a village in which the people are dependent on an old well which dries up in the hot season, bringing drought and starvation.

results.title: Indian Ocean
results.brief_description: Describes the growth of the Empire round the Indian Ocean. Barred from the East Indies, the British established themselves on the mainland of India, where they were followed by the French. The rivalry of these two great nations led to their entry into the politics of India, and intense trading, political and naval rivalry until the fall of Napoleon in 1815.

results.title: Indian festival
results.brief_description: A survey of the festivals of India, seasonal and religious, which take place in large and small communities throughout the land and during all months of the year. Vast numbers of people take part in processions, rituals, re-creations of events, songs and dances to request the assistance of various gods or to thank them for their help during the past year. Brief glimpses of some art forms and decorations associated with the ceremonies are shown.

results.title: Indian eyes on the future
results.brief_description: Shows the progress India is making towards an indpendent future. Highly competent scientists and technologists argue that India must make herself technologically independent quickly, and to do this she must invest heavily in fundamental research, even though many millions of her people still live in squalor. Shows the Plutonium factory near Bombay, the new steel town of Dargapur, and the first atomic power station under construction at Taraput. Presents the enormous problem of education facing India.
